contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Norman Godman |honorific-suffix = |image = |constituency_MP = [[Greenock and Inverclyde (UK Parliament constituency)|Greenock and Inverclyde]]<br /><small>[[Greenock and Port Glasgow (UK Parliament constituency)|Greenock and Port Glasgow]] (1983-1997)</small> |parliament = |majority = |term_start = 9 June 1983 |term_end = 7 June 2001 |predecessor = [[Dickson Mabon]] |successor = [[David Cairns (politician)|David Cairns]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1937|04|19|df=yes}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] |otherparty = |spouse = [[Trish Godman]] (wife) |relations = Gary Mulgrew (stepson) }} {{Inline|date=May 2011}} '''Norman Anthony Godman''' (born 19 April 1937) is a [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[Scottish Labour Party|Labour Party]] politician. He served as [[Scottish MPs|Member of Parliament]] (MP) for [[Greenock and Port Glasgow (UK Parliament constituency)|Greenock and Port Glasgow]] from 1983 to 1997, and for [[Greenock and Inverclyde (UK Parliament constituency)|Greenock and Inverclyde]] from 1997 to 2001. ==Background== Prior to his political career, he was a [[shipwright]] and lecturer, earning a [[PhD]]. He also served in the [[Royal Military Police]] during his [[National Service]]. He first entered Parliament in 1983, and stepped down in 2001. From 1988-1989 he was Opposition spokesman for Agricultural and Rural Affairs. His wife is [[Trish Godman]], [[Member of the Scottish Parliament|Member]] of the [[Scottish Parliament]] for [[West Renfrewshire (Scottish Parliament constituency)|West Renfrewshire]]. ==External links== * http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/person/1956/norman-godman * http://www.theyworkforyou.com/mp/norman_godman/greenock_and_inverclyde * http://assembly.coe.int/ASP/AssemblyList/AL_MemberDetails.asp?MemberID=3129 {{start box}} {{s-par|uk}} {{succession box | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Greenock and Port Glasgow (UK Parliament constituency)|Greenock and Port Glasgow]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1983|1983]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 1997|1997]] | before = [[Dickson Mabon]] | after = ''(constituency abolished)'' }} {{succession box | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Greenock and Inverclyde (UK Parliament constituency)|Greenock and Inverclyde]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1997|1997]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 2001|2001]] | before = ''(new constituency)'' | after = [[David Cairns (politician)|David Cairns]] }} {{end box}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Godman, Norman Anthony | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Lecturer, politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 19 April 1937 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Godman, Norman}} [[Category:1937 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs]] [[Category:Members of the United Kingdom Parliament for Scottish constituencies]] [[Category:Scottish Labour Party politicians]] [[Category:People associated with Inverclyde]] [[Category:UK MPs 1983–1987]] [[Category:UK MPs 1987–1992]] [[Category:UK MPs 1992–1997]] [[Category:UK MPs 1997–2001]] [[Category:British shipwrights]] [[Category:Royal Military Police soldiers]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] {{Scotland-MP-stub}}
